channel.title: Windows vista home premium
channel.description: Ok so i have another quetsion..Well I'd like to know when I select the windows vista home premium upgrade to delete all my files and start with the new ones dose it come with a browser like IE? Please help

item.title: Windows vista home premium
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Yes, it has IE. I was assuming that you’d be doing a clean install since that’s what almost everyone does.

item.title: Windows vista home premium
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

Lol no there are two choices, keep all your files and upgrade(takes six hours and bound to have errors) or Clear install which comes with all windows vista os files…so dose it have IE? Btw we are taking of home premium

Read full topic

item.title: Windows vista home premium
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

The newer Microsoft operating systems that I know of come with IE already installed. If you “upgrade” from XP to Vista, I’m pretty sure you’ll be overwriting XP with Vista. So yes, you’ll lose all of your files. If you have things you want to keep, store them on a flash drive or something.

Read full topic
